alert.note: Alert for Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 28 at 8:24PM MST until March 02 at 5:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible at elevations above 7000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches possible at elevations between 5500 to 7000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...Southern Gila Highlands and the Black Range. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lighter snow amounts are expected across the lowlands of the Gila region with 1 to 3 inches of snow possible.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
